snippet: New York’s bank regulator takes the lead in investigating the practices of a British bank.
abstract: Editorial supports investigation by the New York Department of Financial Services into allegations that London-based bank Standard Chartered has violated American banking rules that restrict transactions with Iranian clients; applauds agency head Benjamin Lawsky for standing his ground and pushing ahead of federal investigators who have been on the Standard Chartered case for years without bring charges or reaching a conclusion.
lead_paragraph: New York’s bank regulator takes the lead in investigating the practices of a British bank.

headline.seo: A Question of Improper Money Flows
headline.main: A Question of Improper Money Flows
